sources.path: evidence/Updated - NG911 Threat Modeling and Risk Assessment - 4.1.docx

tactics.name: Initial Access
tactics.description: Gaining an initial foothold into NG911 or PSAP systems.

techniques.name: Phishing â†’ workstation compromise
techniques.description: Email or chat lures leading to malware on PSAP workstations.

techniques.name: Compromised vendor firmware/software
techniques.description: Malicious update or component from supplier compromises NG components.

techniques.name: LIS impersonation / fake PIDF-LO
techniques.description: Attacker presents forged location or LIS identity.

techniques.name: Caller ID / SIP identity spoofing (SIP INVITE manipulation)
techniques.description: SIP/ANI spoof for fraud, swatting, or TDoS amplification.
techniques.evidence: ThreatModel: caller spoofing; NG-SEC signaling abuse.

techniques.name: LVF / GIS data tampering (poisoning)
techniques.description: Malicious edits to GIS/LVF datasets yielding bad routing.

techniques.name: Location data manipulation or insertion
techniques.description: Attacker alters caller location records or inserts bogus data.

tactics.name: Denial / Disruption
tactics.description: Floods, overloads, or outages degrading service.

techniques.name: Telephone Denial of Service (TDoS) / SIP flood
techniques.description: Mass INVITEs/calls overwhelm queues and ESRP/BCF.

techniques.name: Query flooding (LIS or LVF DoS)
techniques.description: Abuse of LIS/LVF APIs to exhaust capacity.

techniques.name: DoS-induced isolation of legacy PSAPs (LPG failure)
techniques.description: Choking legacy gateways isolates dependent PSAPs.

techniques.name: Exfiltrate caller location or call logs
techniques.description: Bulk exports or covert transfers of LIS/PSAP data.

techniques.name: Exploit software bug in ESRP / ECRF / LIS
techniques.description: RCE/DoS via unpatched services or bad input handling.

techniques.name: TLS / protocol downgrade & insecure protocol usage
techniques.description: Force weak cipher/TLS versions to snoop or meddle.

techniques.name: Legacy traffic injection via LNG
techniques.description: Malformed/hostile legacy signaling passed through LNG.

techniques.name: Unsecured RTP bridging & media path compromise
techniques.description: Unauthenticated RTP or no SRTP lets attacker inject/spy.

techniques.name: Misconfiguration or human error (admin mistake)
techniques.description: Weak ACLs, bad certs, exposed ports, unsafe defaults.

techniques.name: Ransomware / malware targeting PSAP
techniques.description: Encryptors on PSAP workstations/servers crippling ops.
